Articles.Content:
I'm currently desinging an aircraft carrier, currently at 450 parts. This single ship frequently crashes the VAB and whenever i return to the KSC screen. Is there anything i can do to help this? It is an otherwise empty universe.

it only just fits in the... Spaceplane hanger. So could it be its physical size rather than parts? Would docking a couple of smaller aircraft carriers work better in terms of crashes?

are there any fixes out of the game that would help?

Also, when i try to land on the aircraft carrier there is a long pause as it loads it up (and it pretty much breaks as it loads...). Can this be helped?

i have an overclocked 4770k with 8GB of 2133MHz RAM, 750 Sammy Evo SSD and a 7970.
What is the OS you are using? As Windows and Linix are two seprate beasts.
That's really odd for your a system like that - are you sure your drivers etc are updated?
It's probably the size not the part count. I have a simmilar rig and launch a 700 part rocket a lot. It's not the smoothest at launch but not as bad as you describ

I think so, the gpu drivers were done today as my 7970 was returned from RMA today. It doesn't do anything like this for any other games. I haven't done chipset drivers in ages.

once the ship has loaded in it is constant 60fps.

Well one of the problems is that KSP is a 32 bit game. So no matter how good your system is it's limited to 32 bit specs. Meaning 4GB-ish of RAM for starters. So depending on what else you have going on with your comp at the time it could be just hitting that ceiling and crashing. KSP just tends to fall over sideways when you put hundreds of parts into a single vessel. This is why I tend to keep my craft under 100 parts to keep the processing bottleneck in check.
